Concerning the teachings of "Praying to Mary", it isn't the same as we pray to God, it is different. It is more of asking Mary to pray for us, as one asks eachother to pray for them. Mary's body is in heaven; Mary is more close to Jesus than anyone has ever been (She witnessed his conception, birth, works, trial, death, resurrection, and ascension), so it's only logical to ask Mary, specifically, to pray for us. Further, Paul has assured us that those in heaven are not dead, but alive, thus we can also ask the saints and angels to pray for us.
